attributes.action: Investigate Conservative Government for putting their Party ahead of UK
attributes.additional_details: We call for an independent investigation to look at what would be a fair division of the funds for any Government Cuts “relief fund” and then to find out how the Conservative Government could justify the current division of funds (83% expected to go to Conservative-controlled Councils) from an ethical standpoint and a legal standpoint.
attributes.background: The Conservative Government to be investigated for putting the Conservative Party ahead of the well-being of all UK citizens; due to the vast majority of the Government Cuts "relief fund" to be given to Conservative-controlled Councils. This is not representative of the needs of the country.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition as it relates to the Conservative Party, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You could submit a new petition calling for an independent review of the recent local government finance settlement.
